alert.note: Alert for Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 12:34AM CDT until June 10 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Cotton County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Jackson County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Tillman County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Wichita County in northern Texas... Central Wilbarger County in northern Texas... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1233 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cooperton to 6 miles east of Mountain Park to 3 miles west of Frederick to 4 miles southeast of Odell, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...The Altus Mesonet measured a 71 mph wind gust with this line of thunderstorms. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Lawton, Vernon, Frederick, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Snyder, Geronimo, Fletcher, Cyril, Grandfield, Tipton, Chattanooga, Mountain Park, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Davidson, Manitou, Devol and Faxon. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
